message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Debate "character" for 德">
The author is considering "character" for 德. Those who voted against it — what is your single strongest objection to "character"? Those who voted for it — what is its single strongest advantage?

Also: we now know 性 does NOT appear as a standalone technical term in the collection, so the "nature" collision concern is off the table.

Brief responses — one strongest point each.
</teammate-message>

input.content:
**Strongest advantage of "character":** It is the only single-word option that is naturally constructivist *and* naturally universal.

"All things have their character" works in English without strain -- rivers, neighborhoods, soils, dogs, people. And "character" can be either given or built: "the character of the wine developed over years." This ambiguity between the discovered and the constructed is exactly where the author's 德 lives.
input.summary: Defends "character": constructivist + universal in one word

routing.summary: Defends "character": constructivist + universal in one word

content.text: Sent my defense. Waiting for the result of the debate.
